alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 1:50PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW WITH SLICK ROADS AND BLOWING SNOW POSSIBLE TONIGHT AND TOMORROW ACROSS THE LOWER SNAKE PLAIN AND SOUTH END OF THE MAGIC VALLEY... Strong southerly winds this evening and tonight will create localized blowing and drifting snow along the 84 and 86 corridor although little to no snowfall is expected. However, late tonight and throughout Sunday...light to moderate snow will move into the south end of the Magic Valley and Lower Snake Plain. Amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible with locally higher amounts across some of the benches. Gusty west to southwest winds will create localized blowing and drifting snow. Once this happens, impacts will expand and includes Burley, American Falls, Pocatello, Blackfoot...as well along Interstates 15, 84 and 86 in these areas.
